intro: Isocoma drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has silver-green foliage with a woolly texture. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Isocoma drummondii is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
